page.title: 14TRANSPORT
page.content: Since the closure of the Kingsbridge to South Brent railway branch line the only public transport available in the area is the bus. The only settlement still to be served by Western National buses is The Mounts - situated on the only main road. Apart from school buses there is a service to Kingsbridge and Totnes each day, and extra services on Tuesdays and Fridays. Woodleigh, once less than a mile to the railway station, has no longer even a bus service, apart from an early morning school bus. Loddiswell is served by the same school bus, but also has services to Kingsbridge each day and a service to Plymouth on Fridays. These routes are operated by the Kingsbridge based Tally Ho! bus company. It is quite obvious why owning a car is essential!
